intro: Alseis costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican alseis, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Alseis costaricensis is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
